channel.title: CyberNetSec - Supply Chain Attack
channel.description: Latest supply chain attack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: UK Advances New Bill to Regulate Managed Service Providers (MSPs)
item.description:
The United Kingdom government is advancing a new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill aimed at strengthening the nation's digital supply chain. A key provision of the bill is to bring Managed Service Providers (MSPs) under direct regulatory oversight for the first time. Citing the systemic risk demons...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Notepad++ Update Mechanism Hijacked in 6-Month Supply Chain Attack by Chinese APT
item.description:
The maintainers of the widely-used Notepad++ text editor have disclosed a major supply chain attack that compromised their update infrastructure for six months in 2025. The attack, attributed to the Chinese espionage group Lotus Blossom (Billbug), involved hijacking update requests to selectively de...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Open VSX Marketplace Hit by Supply Chain Attack Spreading "GlassWorm" Malware
item.description:
On January 30, 2026, the Open VSX Registry, a popular marketplace for Visual Studio Code extensions, fell victim to a supply chain attack. Threat actors compromised the account of a legitimate developer, 'oorzc', and published malicious updates to four of their popular extensions. These updates embe...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Supply Chain Attack: eScan Antivirus Update Server Compromised to Distribute Malware
item.description:
Indian antivirus provider eScan, a product of MicroWorld Technologies, has suffered a supply chain attack. On January 20, 2026, a regional update server was compromised, causing it to push a malicious file named 'Reload.exe' to enterprise and consumer customers. According to security firm Morphisec,...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: Industry Responds to Threats with New Tools for Supply Chain, AI, and Malware Analysis
item.description:
In response to the evolving threat landscape, several cybersecurity firms have launched new products in January 2026. SpyCloud has released its Supply Chain Threat Protection solution to address identity threats within vendor ecosystems. Vectra AI has enhanced its platform to specifically counter at...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Security Operations, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Open-Source Malware Skyrockets by 75%, Sonatype's 2026 Report Warns
item.description:
Sonatype's 2026 'State of the Software Supply Chain' report reveals an alarming 75% increase in malicious open-source packages, with over 1.233 million identified. The report connects this surge to the rapid adoption of AI and automation in software development, which has accelerated open-source con...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence, Malware

item.title: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of 10M Match Group Users from Hinge & OkCupid
item.description:
The notorious cybercrime group ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for a major data breach impacting Match Group, the parent company of popular dating apps like Hinge, OkCupid, and Match.com. The group posted on a dark web forum that it has stolen over 10 million user records, and released a 1.7...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Malicious PyPI Packages `spellcheckerpy` & `spellcheckpy` Deliver RAT via Hidden Payload
item.description:
A software supply chain attack has been uncovered on the Python Package Index (PyPI), involving two malicious packages named `spellcheckerpy` and `spellcheckpy`. Downloaded over 1,000 times, the packages contained a hidden, dormant payload. A later version update activated the malware, which was des...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: NPM Package 'js-utility-kit' Hijacked in Supply Chain Attack to Steal Crypto Keys and Credentials
item.description:
A significant software supply chain attack has compromised the popular NPM package 'js-utility-kit', which is downloaded over 5 million times per week. Security firm Snyk discovered that malicious versions (2.1.8, 2.1.9, and 2.2.1) were published after the maintainer's account was hijacked via a cre...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Mandates Patching for Four Actively Exploited Flaws in Zimbra, Vite, and More
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added four vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, confirming they are under active attack. The flaws affect a diverse range of products, including Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (CVE-2025-68645), ...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Supply Chain Attack
